Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information about accessible housing in your
authority boundary under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
For this request, the following terms have been defined as:
Accessible home: this means a house or flat that a disabled person can live in independently. The building is designed to be accessible. There might also be accessible equipment such as stair lifts and handrails.
Adaptable home: this means a house or flat that is not yet accessible for a disabled resident. However, it is easy to make changes to this home to make it accessible in the future.
Hammersmith and Fulham used this definition in their Disabled People's Housing Strategy 2021.
As of the year ending 31 December 2022 and 31 December 2023, please
provide the following information concerning all relevant properties
managed by the council.
To the best of your ability:
•Ensure that your figures add up and that totals are provided where needed
•Provide this data in an Excel (.xls) file
•Provide a reference number for further correspondence
Please find the full request below:
1a. How many accessible or adapted homes did the council manage during the period?
1b. How many were occupied vs unoccupied? Please separate them by your council's definitions for these properties.
1c. Were any properties unavailable for any reason(s)? If yes,
how many and why?
2a. For each year, how many accessible or adapted properties were sold by the council via the right to buy as defined in the Housing Act 1985?
2b. Please provide a demographic breakdown of those people to the best of your ability and without triggering a Section 40 exemption.
For the total number of people who purchased homes, can you provide an:
i. Age breakdown
ii. Gender identity
iii. Sexual identity
iv. Ethnic identity
v. Nationality
vi. Breakdown of impairment/disability
Thank you for taking the time to consider my request.
Yours faithfully,
Michael Erhardt

Dear Michael Erhardt,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Accessible Housing
Data which we received on 28/02/2024. We apologise for the delay in
replying to your request for information and now attach our response.
Despite extensive checks we have been unable to supply much of the
information requested due to the way our systems run reports. You’ll note
from our reply that we are migrating our housing information and this
should improve the reporting we can do.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response. Of
course we acknowledge and apologise for the significant delay in
responding.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
